definition: a widemouthed container made typically of earthenware or glass
as much as a jar will hold
examples: ate an entire jar of pickles

definition: to have a harshly disagreeable or disconcerting effect
examples: The noise jarred on her nerves.

definition: to make a harsh or discordant sound
examples: winced as the iron gate jarred against the sidewalk

definition: to be out of harmony, bicker
examples: a course that jarred with his habitual feelings

definition: to cause to jar: such as

examples: The violent opposition jarred his resolve.

definition: to make unstable or loose : shake
an unpleasant break or conflict in rhythm, flow, or transition
a state or manifestation of discord or conflict
